author: The Associated Press
description: A Super Bowl halftime show performer was charged Thursday with two misdemeanors, about 4 1/2 months after he ran across the field at the Superdome waving a flag that included the words “Sudan and Free Gaza,” Louisiana State Police said
title: Super Bowl halftime performer charged for running on field with ‘Sudan and Free Gaza’ flag

author: The Associated Press
description: Former U.S. Rep. Carolyn McCarthy, who successfully ran for Congress in 1996 as a crusader for gun control after a mass shooting on a New York commuter train left her husband dead and her son severely wounded, has died.
title: Gun control crusader and former U.S. Rep. Carolyn McCarthy dead at 81

author: The Politics Desk
description: Illinois Democratic Gov. JB Pritzker's decision to run for re-election could impact a future 2028 presidential bid.
title: How JB Pritzker's decision to run for re-election could impact his 2028 aspirations

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: As attorneys try to free  a 6-year-old boy treated for blood and bone marrow cancer, his mother and sibling, they're challenging the Trump administration’s immigration court arrests.
title: Attorneys challenge immigration arrest, detention of child treated for cancer

author: Samantha Subin, CNBC
description: It’s a bittersweet day for Windows users
title: Microsoft says goodbye to the Windows blue screen of death

author: Andrew Greif
description: The discipline comes six months after the former Ravens kicker was accused by 16 massage therapists of unwanted advances or behavior during sessions between 2012-16.
title: Justin Tucker suspended first 10 weeks of NFL season for violation of personal conduct policy

author: Kamaron McNair, CNBC
description: Both the House and Senate versions of the budget reconciliation bill include an increase to the child tax credit, but the House’s version gives a larger payout to families
title: The child tax credit could be worth over $2,000 under Republicans' spending plan—but millions of families wouldn't benefit

author: Kif Leswing, CNBC
description: Apple Thursday made changes to its App Store European policies, saying it believes the new rules will help the company avoid a fine of 500 million euro ($585 million) from the EU for violating the Digital Markets Act
title: Apple reveals complex system of App Store fees to avoid EU fine of 500 million euro

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell mostly breezed through two hearings on Capitol Hill this week but now heads into a much bigger challenge: a potential threat that President Donald Trump could undermine his authority by soon naming his pick to head the central bank next year
title: Trump's war against the Powell Fed has taken another political turn

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Prosecutor details Sean Combs' alleged criminal 'kingdom' in closing arguments

author: The Associated Press
description: Bill Moyers, the former White House press secretary who became one of television’s most honored journalists, masterfully using a visual medium to illuminate a world of ideas, died Thursday at age 91
title: Bill Moyers, the former White House press secretary turned acclaimed TV journalist, dead at 91

description: S’ABLE Labs CEO and co-founder Sabrina Elba and World Vision partnered on a trip to Tamale, Ghana, to look at the role child labor plays in the sourcing of cosmetic ingredients. The beauty company hopes to honor rural people and source ingredients responsibly.
title: Beauty company promotes ethical sourcing in cosmetic industry

author: Andrew Blankstein
description: LOS ANGELES — Police are investigating a reported burglary at “F1” actor Brad Pitt’s home, two law enforcement sources familiar with the incident told NBC News on Thursday.
title: Thieves scaled fence, busted window before ransacking Brad Pitt's L.A. home, sources say

author: Angela Yang
description: Zohran Mamdani’s online videos have echoes of the meme-fueled Kamala Harris presidential campaign, but there were key differences.
title: Zohran Mamdani's social media strategy was about more than viral videos

author: Aria Bendix
description: A longtime anti-vaccine activist gave a presentation at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s vaccine advisory committee meeting Thursday on an issue that has long been considered settled science
title: Anti-vaccine activist presents data to RFK Jr.'s reshaped CDC advisory panel

author: Matt Lavietes
description: "Love Island USA" contestant Cashel Barnett has been accused of sexually assaulting his former girlfriend, adding to other allegations against the reality star, who was jailed last month
title: 'Love Island USA' contestant Cashel Barnett accused of sexual assault

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A possible meteorite was spotted shooting through the sky in the Southeastern U.S. on Thursday
title: Possible meteor spotted shooting through the Southeast

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Some conservatives called for the parliamentarian to be fired or overruled after she determined a series of policies in the legislation didn't comply with Senate budget rules.
title: Republicans are dealt a setback on their big bill as Senate referee disqualifies key provisions

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump delivers remarks from the East Room on the “One Big Beautiful Bill,” his administration’s signature legislation aimed at delivering tax cuts and benefits to working Americans.
title: Trump delivers remarks on his 'One Big Beautiful Bill'

author: Andrew Greif
description: Faith Kipyegon's attempt to become the first woman to run a mile in less than four minutes came up 6.91 seconds short Thursday.
title: Faith Kipyegon runs fastest mile ever by a woman, but falls short of sub-4 goal

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: A bookstore in San Francisco announced earlier this month that it will no longer sell titles by J.K.
title: San Francisco bookstore stops selling J.K. Rowling titles due to author's anti-trans views

author: Monica Alba
description: The White House plans to limit intelligence sharing with members of Congress after an early damage assessment of Iran’s nuclear sites leaked this week.
title: White House to limit intelligence sharing with Congress after leak of early Iran report

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: American Vogue is set to hire a new head of editorial content, a function held by Anna Wintour for decades.
title: American Vogue to hire new head of editorial, role held by Anna Wintour for 40 years

description: Closing arguments have begun in the sex trafficking trial of music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs, with prosecutors making the case that Combs used violence, power and fear to coerce women into sex parties known as "freak offs". Combs has pleaded not guilty and faces life in prison if he is convicted.
title: Prosecutors make closing arguments in Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Idaho officials are looking for two missing teenagers connected to the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
title: Amber alert issued for 2 missing Idaho teens linked to FLDS

author: The Associated Press
description: The case behind the U.S. Supreme Court ruling legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide a decade ago is known as Obergefell v. Hodges, but the two Ohio men whose names became that title weren't so at odds as it would seem, and are now friends.
title: Once opponents in the Supreme Court case that legalized gay marriage, now they're friends

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Atlanta sports reporter Tabitha Turner alleges she was pepper-sprayed in the face and physically attacked by an Uber driver over the weekend following a dispute over the car temperature
title: Atlanta sports reporter says she was pepper-sprayed and attacked by an Uber driver

author: Pilar Melendez
description: The wife of the man accused in the Minnesota lawmaker shootings spoke out for the first time Thursday, calling his actions that left two dead and two others injured "a betrayal."Vance Boelter, 57, is facing state and federal charges in connection with two June 14 shootings at the homes of Democratic Minnesota House Speaker Emerita Melissa Hortman and Democratic state Sen.
title: Wife of Minnesota lawmaker shooting suspect calls husband’s alleged actions ‘a betrayal’

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court is set to conclude its nine-month term on Friday with a flurry of rulings including a closely watched case concerning birthright citizenship.
title: Supreme Court is set to issue rulings on birthright citizenship and five other cases on term's final day

author: The Associated Press
description: The federal agency charged with protecting workers' civil rights has terminated a New York administrative judge who opposed White House directives, including President Donald Trump's executive order decreeing male and female as two "immutable" sexes
title: A judge resisted Trump's order on gender identity. The EEOC just fired her

author: Ronny Rojas
description: The majority of the Constitutional Court's justices found the government violated the migrants' rights by not giving them access to counsel or enough information about their status.
title: Court orders Costa Rican government to release Asian migrants deported by Trump

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday ruled for South Carolina over its effort to defund Planned Parenthood, concluding that individual Medicaid patients cannot sue to enforce their right to pick a medical provider.
title: Supreme Court rules for South Carolina over bid to defund Planned Parenthood

author: Reuters
description: Israel has halted aid supplies to Gaza for two days to prevent them being seized by Hamas, an official said.
title: Israel halts aid, official says, as Palestinian clans in Gaza deny Hamas is stealing it

author: MacKenzie Sigalos, CNBC
description: In a landmark shift for the U.S. housing finance system, the Federal Housing Finance Agency has issued a directive ordering Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to formally consider cryptocurrency as an asset in single-family mortgage loan risk assessments
title: Trump administration moves to count crypto as a federal mortgage asset

author: Matt Lavietes
description: The man suspected of using a "makeshift flamethrower" on demonstrators marching in Boulder in support of Israeli hostages held by Hamas has been charged with 12 federal hate crimes
title: Suspect in Colorado attack on Israeli hostage advocates is hit with federal hate crime charges

author: The Associated Press
description: A group of Dallas-area families and faith leaders have filed a lawsuit seeking to block a new Texas law that requires copies of the Ten Commandments be posted in every public school classroom
title: Texas' Ten Commandments in schools law challenged by families and faith leaders in lawsuit

author: Peter Guo
description: A girl was found alive and unharmed more than seven hours after heavy rain swept her into a sewer in China, rescuers said.
title: 8-year-old girl pulled from sewer after 7 hours as floods batter southern China

description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth criticized the media during a Pentagon press briefing over reports on the effectiveness of U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. NBC News Dan De Luce has details on the strike reports and Hegseth's comments to the press in the room.
title: Hegseth slams media over reports on effectiveness of Iran nuclear site strikes

author: The Associated Press
description: LOS ANGELES — The vice mayor of a small Southern California city is under fire after appearing to call on street gangs to organize in the face of immigration sweeps by federal agents in and around Los Angeles
title: California official criticized for appearing to call on gangs to intervene in immigration raids

description: Closing arguments are set to get underway Thursday in the high profile criminal trial of Sean “Diddy” Combs after Combs' defense team elected to call no witnesses and rested their case in less than 30 minutes. NBC’s Chloe Melas reports for TODAY.
title: Closing Arguments Set in Sean 'Diddy' Combs Sex Trafficking Trial

description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei is speaking out for the first time since the U.S. attacks on his country, claiming "victory" over the United States and Israel, and adding that the U.S. achieved nothing with its strikes. Meanwhile, President Donald Trump is insisting it was a knockout blow, forcefully disputing preliminary findings that Iran's nuclear program was set back by just a matter of months. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: Iran's Supreme Leader Speaks Out on US Strikes for First Time

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A new poll reveals Americans’ early feelings about U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.
title: Americans' thoughts on Iran strikes and 10 years since Obergefell v. Hodges: Morning Rundown

description: Millions across the United States are bracing for another round of oppressive heat after more than a dozen locations from South Carolina to Connecticut set record highs on Wednesday. NBC’s Shaquille Brewster reports and TODAY’s Al Roker tracks the forecast.
title: Brutal Early Summer Heat Wave Clashes With Severe Storms

author: Gina Vivinetto, TODAY
description: Tanner Martin, the Utah dad who went viral for documenting his journey after receiving a stage 4 colon cancer diagnosis at 25, has died
title: Utah dad Tanner Martin dies weeks after welcoming 1st baby amid cancer battle

author: Chrissy Callahan, TODAY
description: It’s the end of the road for one iconic “Simpsons” character.
title: Is Marge Simpson really dead? 'The Simpsons' season 36 finale leaves fans reeling

author: Gina Vivinetto, TODAY
description: Sabrina Carpenter is offering up a less controversial image for her “Man’s Best Friend” album cover after the initial art sparked a wave of backlash.“i signed some copies of Man’s Best Friend for you guys & here is a new alternate cover approved by God.
title: Sabrina Carpenter releases alternate Album cover after online backlash: 'approved by God'

author: Alexander Smith
description: Iranian lawmakers voted to suspend cooperation with the IAEA, as Ayatollah Ali Khamenei made his first comments in more than a week.
title: Iran votes to suspend cooperation with nuclear watchdog after U.S. strikes

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: President Donald Trump has called for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s long-running corruption trial a “witch hunt” and called for it to be canceled.
title: Trump brands Netanyahu's corruption trial a 'witch hunt,' calls for it to be canceled

author: Andrew Greif
description: Which teams got better and which teams made questionable picks in Wednesday's NBA Draft? Let's break it all down.
title: How Cooper Flagg fits with the Mavericks, plus other takeaways from the NBA Draft

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: A DOJ official boasted that he was able to kill a Texas law that gave undocumented immigrants in-state tuition by coordinating with Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton.
title: DOJ coordinated with Texas AG to kill Texas Dream Act, Trump official says

author: Steven Romo
description: Jim Obergefell, the plaintiff in the Supreme Court’s landmark same-sex marriage case, urges LGBTQ advocates not to let their guards down.
title: A decade after the U.S. legalized gay marriage, Jim Obergefell says the fight isn't over

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: In Nebraska, the state’s largest worksite immigration raid sent a chilling effect across the city of Omaha this month when federal immigration authorities arrested 76 employees of a meatpacking plant
title: How a Nebraska immigration raid tied to an identity theft investigation unfolded

author: Marc Trussler
description: President Donald Trump’s decision to launch airstrikes Saturday on several nuclear facilities in Iran has divided Americans and exposed fault lines within the coalitions of both the parties, according to a new NBC News Decision Desk Poll powered by SurveyMonkey.
title: More Americans oppose the U.S. strikes on Iran, as MAGA supporters line up with Trump

author: Denise Chow
description: Dangerously hot and humid conditions are choking nearly the entire eastern half of the United States this week, caused by a “heat dome” that's parked over parts of the country
title: Why do heat domes bring oppressive temperatures?

author: The Associated Press
description: A Harvard University researcher accused of smuggling clawed frog embryos into the United States was indicted Wednesday on additional charges.
title: Harvard researcher accused of smuggling frog embryos faces additional charges

author: Reuters
description: The push to impose new controls on recreational use of cannabis comes after the Bhumjaithai Party, which championed its legalization, withdrew from the ruling coalition last week.
title: Thailand moves to recriminalize cannabis, shaking $1 billion industry

author: The Associated Press
description: Fugitive drug lord and gang leader José Adolfo Macías, wanted by both the U.S. and Ecuador, was recaptured a year after his mysterious escape from Guayaquil prison.
title: Ecuador recaptures gang leader wanted in the U.S. more than a year after his prison escape

author: Reuters
description: Vietnam will remove the death penalty for eight offenses from next month, including embezzlement and activities aimed at overthrowing the government, sparing the life of a tycoon in a $12-billion fraud case.
title: Vietnam to remove death penalty for embezzlement, sparing tycoon's life

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Eleanor Holmes Norton, 88, has said twice this month that she will seek another term in the House. Each time her office pumped the brakes.
title: D.C. delegate in Congress insists for second time she's running for re-election. Her office again says no decision yet.

author: The Associated Press
description: Denis Villeneuve is going from “Dune” to Bond.
title: Denis Villeneuve to direct first James Bond film under Amazon MGM

author: Scott Stump, TODAY
description: Former “Blue’s Clues” host Steve Burns is starting a podcast that aims to continue conversations from the iconic Nickelodeon show, except now for grown-ups
title: Former ‘Blue’s Clues’ host Steve Burns to launch a podcast for adults

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: Iranian asylum-seekers who fled the Islamic Republic have been arrested recently by immigration officials in Los Angeles.
title: Iranian woman suffers severe panic attack as ICE agents arrest her husband

author: Hayden Mitman, NBC Philadelphia
description: A lifeguard has been hospitalized after she was impaled by a beach umbrella as she attempted to capture it when the wind blew it away in Asbury Park, New Jersey, on Wednesday morning, officials said
title: Lifeguard hospitalized after being impaled by beach umbrella at Jersey Shore

author: Phil Helsel
description: A man at a baseball game who ridiculed the dead mother of the Arizona Diamondbacks' Ketel Marte has been banned by the White Sox and Major League Baseball indefinitely, the league confirmed Wednesday.
title: Man who taunted Ketel Marte about late mother banned by MLB, White Sox
